us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.interfaces

Interface FrameConvexPolygon2DReadOnly

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly, FrameVertex2DSupplier, ReferenceFrameHolder, Vertex2DSupplier
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FixedFrameConvexPolygon2DBasics, FrameConvexPolygon2DBasics
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FrameConvexPolygon2D

    public interface FrameConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
extends ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly, ReferenceFrameHolder, FrameVertex2DSupplier
    Read-only interface for a convex polygon defined in the XY-plane expressed in an immutable reference frame.

    This implementation of convex polygon is designed for garbage free operations.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.interfaces.FrameVertex2DSupplier

    • Method Detail

      • getVertexBufferView

        java.util.List<? extends FramePoint2DReadOnly> getVertexBufferView()
        Gets a read-only view of this polygon internal vertex buffer.

        WARNING: The size of the returned list is usually greater than the size of this polygon. The vertices currently composing this polygon are located at the indices ∈ [0; this.getNumberOfVertices()[.

        The returned list is an unmodifiable list created with Collections.unmodifiableList(List).

        Specified by:
        getVertexBufferView in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        a read-only view of this polygon internal vertex buffer.

      • getPolygonVerticesView

        default java.util.List<? extends FramePoint2DReadOnly> getPolygonVerticesView()
        Gets a read-only view of this polygon vertices.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        The returned list is an unmodifiable list created with Collections.unmodifiableList(List).

        Specified by:
        getPolygonVerticesView in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        a read-only view of this polygon vertices.

        Note that the first vertex has the lowest x-coordinate.

      • getCentroid

        FramePoint2DReadOnly getCentroid()
        Gets the read-only reference to the polygon's centroid.

        The centroid is not necessarily equal to the average of this polygon's vertices.

        When viewing a polygon as a physical object with constant density and thickness, the centroid is equivalent to the polygon's center of mass.

        Specified by:
        getCentroid in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        the read-only reference to this polygon's centroid.

      • getClosestPointWithRay

        default FramePoint2DBasics getClosestPointWithRay(Line2DReadOnly ray)
        Computes the coordinates of the closest point to the ray that belongs to this convex polygon.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        WARNING: This methods assumes that the ray does not intersect with the polygon. Such scenario should be handled with ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly.intersectionWithRay(Line2DReadOnly, Point2DBasics, Point2DBasics).

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns null.
        • If the ray is parallel to the closest edge, the closest point to the ray origin is chosen.

        Specified by:
        getClosestPointWithRay in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Parameters:
        ray - the ray to find the closest point to. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the closest point if the method succeeds, null otherwise.

        Returns:
        the coordinates of the closest point if the method succeeds, null otherwise.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if ray and this are not expressed in the same reference frame.
        See Also:
        getClosestPointWithRay(Line2DReadOnly)

        Computes the orthogonal projection of a 2D point on this 2D convex polygon.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns null.
        • If the polygon has exactly one vertex, the result is the polygon only vertex.
        • If the query is inside the polygon, the method fails and returns null.

      • lineOfSightStartVertexCopy

        default FramePoint2DBasics lineOfSightStartVertexCopy(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly observer)
        From the point of view of an observer located outside the polygon, only a continuous subset of the polygon's edges can be seen defining a line-of-sight. This method finds the first vertex that is in the line-of-sight.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given observer is located outside the polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • The polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns null.
        • The observer is inside the polygon, this method fails and returns null.
        • The polygon has exactly one vertex, this method succeeds and returns the vertex coordinates if the observer is different from the polygon's vertex, or returns null if the observer is equal to the polygon's vertex.

        Specified by:
        lineOfSightStartVertexCopy in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Parameters:
        observer - the coordinates of the observer. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the first vertex in the line-of-sight or null if this method failed. Modified.

      • lineOfSightStartVertexCopy

        default FramePoint2DBasics lineOfSightStartVertexCopy(FramePoint2DReadOnly observer)
        From the point of view of an observer located outside the polygon, only a continuous subset of the polygon's edges can be seen defining a line-of-sight. This method finds the first vertex that is in the line-of-sight.
        Parameters:
        observer - the coordinates of the observer. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the first vertex in the line-of-sight or null if this method failed. Modified.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if observer and this are not expressed in the same reference frame.
        See Also:
        lineOfSightStartVertexCopy(Point2DReadOnly)

      • lineOfSightVertices

        default FramePoint2DBasics[] lineOfSightVertices(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly observer)
        From the point of view of an observer located outside the polygon, only a continuous subset of the polygon's edges can be seen defining a line-of-sight. This method finds the first and last vertices that is in the line-of-sight.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        WARNING: This method assumes that the given observer is located outside the polygon.

        Edge cases:

        • The polygon has no vertices, this method fails and returns null.
        • The observer is inside the polygon, this method fails and returns null.
        • The polygon has exactly one vertex, this method succeeds and returns the vertex coordinates if the observer is different from the polygon's vertex, or returns null if the observer is equal to the polygon's vertex.

        Specified by:
        lineOfSightVertices in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Parameters:
        observer - the coordinates of the observer. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the coordinates in order of the first and last vertices in the line-of-sight or null if this method failed. Modified.

      • canObserverSeeEdge

        default boolean canObserverSeeEdge(int edgeIndex,
                                   FramePoint2DReadOnly observer)
        Determines whether an observer can see the outside of the given edge of this convex polygon.
        Parameters:
        edgeIndex - the vertex index of the start of the edge.
        observer - the coordinates of the observer. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the observer can see the outside of the edge, false if the observer cannot see the outside or is lying on the edge.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if observer and this are not expressed in the same reference frame.

      • intersectionWith

        default int intersectionWith(Line2DReadOnly line,
                             us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics firstIntersectionToPack,
                             FixedFramePoint2DBasics secondIntersectionToPack)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersection(s) between a given line 2D and this convex polygon 2D.
        Parameters:
        line - the line that may intersect this polygon. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the first intersection between the line and the convex polygon. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the second intersection between the line and the convex polygon. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line and the polygon.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if code secondIntersectionToPack and this are not expressed in the same reference frame.
        See Also:
        ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly.intersectionWith(Line2DReadOnly, Point2DBasics, Point2DBasics)

        Parameters:
        lineSegment2D - the line segment that may intersect this polygon. Not modified.
        firstIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the first intersection between the line and the convex polygon. Can be null. Modified.
        secondIntersectionToPack - point in which the coordinates of the second intersection between the line and the convex polygon. Can be null. Modified.
        Returns:
        the number of intersections between the line and the polygon.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if firstIntersectionToPack, secondIntersectionToPack, and this are not expressed in the same reference frame.
        See Also:
        ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly.intersectionWith(LineSegment2DReadOnly, Point2DBasics, Point2DBasics)

      • intersectionWith

        default FramePoint2DBasics[] intersectionWith(LineSegment2DReadOnly lineSegment2D)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersection(s) between a given line segment 2D and this convex polygon 2D.

        WARNING: This method generates garbage.

        Edge cases:

        • If the polygon has no vertices, this method behaves as if there is no intersections and this method returns null.
        • If no intersections exist, this method returns null.
        • If the line segment is collinear to an edge:
          • The edge entirely contains the line segment: this method finds two intersections which are the endpoints of the line segment.
          • The line segment entirely contains the edge: this method finds two intersections which are the vertices of the edge.
          • The edge and the line segment partially overlap: this method finds two intersections which the polygon's vertex that on the line segment and the line segment's endpoint that is on the polygon's edge.

        Specified by:
        intersectionWith in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Parameters:
        lineSegment2D - the line segment that may intersect this polygon. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the intersections between the line segment and the polygon.

      • intersectionWith

        default FramePoint2DBasics[] intersectionWith(FrameLineSegment2DReadOnly lineSegment2D)
        Computes the coordinates of the possible intersection(s) between a given line segment 2D and this convex polygon 2D.
        Parameters:
        lineSegment2D - the line segment that may intersect this polygon. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the intersections between the line segment and the polygon.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if lineSegment2D and this are not expressed in the same reference frame.
        See Also:
        intersectionWith(LineSegment2DReadOnly)

      • equals

        default boolean equals(FrameConvexPolygon2DReadOnly other)
        Tests on a per vertex and per component basis, if this polygon is exactly equal to other.
        Parameters:
        other - the other polygon to compare against this. Not modified.
        Returns:
        true if the two polygons are exactly equal component-wise and expressed in the same frame reference frame, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly.equals(ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly)

      • epsilonEquals

        default boolean epsilonEquals(FrameConvexPolygon2DReadOnly other,
                              double epsilon)
        Tests on a per-component basis on every vertices if this convex polygon is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon.

        The method returns false if the two polygons have different size.

        The method returns false if the two polygons are expressed in different frames.

        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:
        true if the two line segments are equal, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly.epsilonEquals(ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly, double)

      • geometricallyEquals

        default boolean geometricallyEquals(FrameConvexPolygon2DReadOnly other,
                                    double epsilon)
        Compares this and other to determine if the two convex polygons are geometrically similar.

        This method performs the comparison on a per vertex basis while accounting for a possible shift in the polygon indexing. For instance, two polygons that have the same vertices in clockwise or counter-clockwise order, are considered geometrically equal even if they do not start with the same vertex.

        Parameters:
        other - the convex polygon to compare to.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the convex polygons represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ReferenceFrameMismatchException - if other and this are not expressed in the same reference frame.
        See Also:
        ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly.geometricallyEquals(ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly, double)
